initial_story:
The Eurovision Song Contest is just around the corner and this year, it's taking place in Malmo, Sweden.

You can find out all about the event right here.

The UK's entry for 2024 is Olly Alexander who'll be performing his song, Dizzy.

But how's he feeling ahead of the big night, where he'll perform in front of 200 million people!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

The Eurovision Song contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.
stories:
The European Music Festival, known as Eurovision, is rapidly approaching, and this year, it's being held in the vibrant city of Malmo, Sweden. For all the latest news and updates, check out this link.

The representative for the United Kingdom this year is none other than Olly Alexander. He'll be gracing the stage with his captivating performance of the song "Dazzling."

But as the excitement builds, how does Olly feel about taking the stage in front of an estimated 200 million viewers? To find out, join us as we chat with him about his preparation for the competition.

Mark your calendars! The Eurovision Song Contest Grand Final will be aired live on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday, 11 May.

The enchanting Eurovision Music Festival, set to take place in the culturally rich city of Malmo, Sweden, is fast approaching. Keep up-to-date with the latest news and developments by visiting this link.

Representing the United Kingdom this year is the talented Olly Alexander. His mesmerizing performance of the song "Shimmer" is sure to leave audiences dazzled.

Ahead of the competition, we had the opportunity to speak with Olly about his preparations and thoughts on performing in front of an estimated 200 million viewers.

Don't miss the Eurovision Song Contest Grand Final, airing live on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday, 18 May.

The magical Eurovision Music Festival, set to take place in the historically profound city of Prague, Czech Republic, is just around the corner. Stay informed about the latest updates and announcements by visiting our website.

This year, representing the dynamic and creative country of Spain, we have the charismatic Blas Cantó. His captivating performance of the song "Miracle" promises to leave the audience in awe.

Before the big night, we were fortunate enough to sit down with Blas and discuss his preparations and excitement about performing in front of an anticipated 300 million viewers.

Mark your calendars and join us for the Eurovision Song Contest Grand Final, broadcasting live on La Sexta and BBC One, as well as on BBC iPlayer and La Sexta's streaming platforms, on Saturday, 25 May.

The enchanting Eurovision Music Celebration, set to unfold in the culturally rich city of Prague, Czech Republic, is rapidly approaching. Keep abreast of the latest news and developments by checking our website.

This year, gracing the stage for the vibrant and innovative nation of Spain, is the magnetic Ana Mena. Her mesmerizing rendition of the song "Dancing in the Rain" is guaranteed to enthrall the crowd.

In an exclusive interview prior to the event, we had the privilege of speaking with Ana about her rehearsals and eagerness to captivate an estimated 350 million viewers.

Save the date and join us for the Eurovision Song Contest Grand Final, airing live on Telecinco and BBC One, as well as on BBC iPlayer and Telecinco's streaming services, on Saturday, 31 May.
